item.title: ORCID
item.description: If you do not have an ORCID, register one here: orcid.org/register. Itâ€™s free! from info.orcid.org/researchers/: ORCID, which stands for Open Researcher and Contributor ID, is a free, unique, persistent identifier (PID) for individuals to use as they engage in research, scholarship, and innovation activities.

item.title: DOI
item.description: From www.doi.org: A DOI (Digital Object Identifier) name is a digital identifier of an object, any object â€” physical, digital, or abstract. DOIs solve a common problem: keeping track of things.

item.title: ISSN
item.description: from www.issn.org/: An ISSN is an 8-digit code used to identify newspapers, journals, magazines and periodicals of all kinds and on all mediaâ€“print and electronic ...

item.title: Import metadata from another source
item.description: Besides manually entering data, you can retrieve metadata from various sources. Several can be set up to automatically notify you when a new work has been found that is attributed to you.

item.title: Research Output data @ UT
item.description: Development preview - do not use as a a guide! These pages are under development. The content is far from complete. For the actual guides, visit the UT service portal page for the RIS.
